availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
The State of Ohio
Hamilton County } SS
City of Cincinnati

Adolphe H. Bocking, being first duly affirmed says that he will well and duly Execute and perform all the duties of his station as a Commissioner of deeds for the State of Kentucky within the State of Ohio.

On the 4th day of September A D 1861, this affiant made and subscribed an affidavit in duplicate as by law required to qualify him to act as commissioner to take acknowledgement of deeds &c, in Ohio for Kentucky, one being indorsed on the Commission to him issued from the office of the Secretary of State for Kentucky and the other was the same on next day sent per mail to said office.
Affirmed to before me and subscribed in my presence by the said Adolphe H. Bocking this 1st day of August A. D. 1863.
Witness my hand and seal of office at Cincinnati, on the day and year last aforesaid

figure.ab:
D. K. CADY, JR.
A COMMISSIONER IN OHIO
CINCINNATI, HAMILTON COUNTY, OHIO

body.p:
D. K Cady Jr
Commissioner for Kentucky

Ohio
Oath of A. H. Bocking
Comr of Deeds
Filed Aug 4. 1863.
